title: Abel elliptic functions
summary: In mathematics Abel elliptic functions are a special kind of elliptic functions, that were established by the Norwegian mathematician Niels Henrik Abel. He published his paper "Recherches sur les Fonctions elliptiques" in Crelle's Journal in 1827.[1] It was the first work on elliptic functions that was actually published.[2] Abel's work on elliptic functions also influenced Jacobi's studies of elliptic functions, whose 1829 published book "Fundamenta nova theoriae functionum ellipticarum" became the standard work on elliptic functions.[3]
